basic_info.name: Dravidian University Scholarships
description: The following scholarships are offered at Dravidian University-

Aside from that, the Dravidian University grants scholarships to students who place first, second, or third in the university's Ph. D. Entrance Exam (full time). The top-ranked students are awarded a scholarship of 1200 rupees for a three-year term.

faqs.question: Ques. How much are the application fees for DUCET?
faqs.answer: Ans.The university office accepts applications for entrance examinations for admission to various programs. Each course requires a separate application. Applicants must pay the specified entrance examination fees of INR 350 (for general/BC applicants) and INR 250 (for SC/ST/Differently Abled candidates) to the university office in the form of a Demand Draft (DD).

faqs.question: Ques. Does Dravidian University offer any Certification Courses?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, the college offers certification courses in Tamil, German, Malayalam, Telugu, Communicative English, Fitness Training, Tulu.

faqs.question: What documents are required at Dravidian University admission?
faqs.answer: Ans.The necessary documents that need to be submitted during the admission process at Dravidian University are the 12th Marksheet along with Passing Certificate, Transfer Certificate, Character Certificate, Income Certificate, and Category Certificate.

faqs.question: Ques. Does Dravidian University offers any specializations for Ph.D.Course?
faqs.answer: Dravidian University offers Ph.D. in English, Tulu, Business Management, Computer Science, Physical Education, Tamil, Chemistry, Philosophy, History, Linguistics, Kannada, Biotechnology, Education, Comparative Dravidian Literature, Telugu, Library, and Information.

faqs.question: Ques. What is B.Ed Admission process at Dravidian University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Dravidian University takes admission in B.Ed through AP EDCET. It is a state level entrance exam that is conducted by Sri Venkateshwara University to admit candidates in B.Ed. Course.

Section.name: About Dravidian University
Section.description:
Dravidian University has been accredited with a B grade from NAAC and is recognized by the UGC. There are 30 academic departments and four centers within the university. It's a public university and was established in the year 1997.
Undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma and certificate programs are available at Dravidian University in a variety of subjects. Admissions to these programs are held once a year.
It also offers Distance education courses. Dravidian University's Directorate of Remote Education was established in 2008 in the Chittoor District of Andhra Pradesh to deliver quality distance education. DDE offers B.A., B.Com., BBA, BCA, B. Lib, and B.Sc. courses at the undergraduate level, as well as M.A., MCA, M. Com, M.Sc., MBA, M. Lib, and PG Diploma courses at the graduate level. Admissions to all these courses are based on the performance of the students in the qualifying examinations. Application forms can be filled in through offline mode.
Read More: Dravidian University Reviews
Table of Content
Dravidian University has 7 departments to offer courses in various specializations, these are School of Commerce & Management, School of Education & Human Resource Development, School of Comparative Literature and Translation Studies, School of Information Science and Technology, School of Human and Social Sciences, School of Herbal Studies and Nature Science.
